dt: used to express surprise, triumph, or derision

dt.t: "{wi}Aha{/wi}! we've found the thief, then!" said the conductor.
The Professor smiled, and looked quite jubilant. He rubbed his hands together, and said, "{wi}Aha{/wi}! I thought I had diagnosed the case. My treatment is working."
"{wi}Aha{/wi}! Doctor!" said the Colonel at last, with a doltish sneer, "you bear your years well."

shortdef: —used to express surprise, triumph, or derision

dt.t: The product also includes 6 percent alpha hydroxy acid ({wi}AHA{/wi}), an exfoliator, to enhance the growth of new healthy skin.
{wi}AHAs{/wi} loosen the bonding between the outermost skin cells, encouraging them to slough off and reveal the fresh new skin beneath.

dt: {bc}a moment of sudden realization, inspiration, insight, recognition, or comprehension

dt.t: The {wi}aha moment{/wi} you experience when you've been trying to remember the name of a song and three hours later it hits you …

dt: {it}Aha{/it} is sometimes followed by an exclamation point and is also often placed in quotation marks.

dt.t: That was the {wi}"Aha!" moment{/wi} … that made the befuddlement worthwhile.
Her {wi}"aha" moment{/wi} came about two years ago …

shortdef: a moment of sudden realization, inspiration, insight, recognition, or comprehension
